knimeNode.name: Spark to Parquet
knimeNode.shortDescription: Converts an incoming Spark RDD into a parquet table

fullDescription.intro: Converts an incoming Spark RDD into a parquet table.
fullDescription.option:
Error (default): When saving a Spark RDD to a parquet table, if data/table already exists, an exception is expected to be thrown.
Append: When saving a DataFrame to a parquet table, if data/table already exists, contents of the RDD are expected to be appended to existing data.
Overwrite: Overwrite mode means that when saving a RDD to a parquet table, if data/table already exists, existing data is expected to be overwritten by the contents of the RDD.
Ignore: Ignore mode means that when saving a RDD to a parquet table, if data/table already exists, the save operation is expected to not save the contents of the RDD and to not change the existing data. This is similar to a CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS in SQL.
See also save modes section spark documentation.

ports.inPort: A HDFS or SSH connection to the remote spark cluster
